etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in Thomas Blount (1618–1679), antiquary and lexicographer. From classical Latin laterīcius, laterītius made of brick (from later brick + -īcius: see -itious) + -ous

definitions: Resembling or made of brick; specifically of the colour of brick; brick red or (Mycology) dark brick-red; designating this colour.
